newsitem.title: SWITZERLAND: ABB wins $90 mln nuclear contract.
newsitem.headline: ABB wins $90 mln nuclear contract.

text.p: Electrical engineering group ABB Asea Brown Boveri AG said it had won a long-term contract to supply the U.S. utility, Baltimore Gas & Electric Co (BG&E), with nuclear fuel fabrication and related services.
ABB said in a statement the contract was valued at more than $90 million and extends ABB's current fuel supply contract with the utility from 1999 to 2013.
The contract covers BG&E's Calvert Cliffs plant, units 1 and 2, in Lusby, Maryland.
The contract will satisfy BG&E's fuel fabrication needs through the end of Calvert Cliff's current operating license.
The nuclear fuel assemblies for both units will be manufactured at ABB facilities in the U.S.
The order was won by ABB Compustion Engineering Nuclear Operations of the U.S., a member of ABB's Power Generation Segment.
